reviews.review_msg: He's a very nice and funny guy which makes his lectures engaging, clearly passionate about his studies. Unfortunately can get a little distracted at times but if you show up to class and do readings will do well.

The professor is easily the best I have ever had. He is knowledgeable and he has the best teaching style ever. I like how he encourages students to be curious, absorb ideas and also develop ones of their own. His simulations and discussions were the best! Make the most of his lectures and office hours. He is a rare gem!
Probably my favorite professor at SFU, he's a nice guy, and his course is interesting. He's a pretty easy grader, so as long as you pay attention during lectures and do the readings, you'll do great.

Professor Mukherjee was very nice and made it as clear as possible what would be on midterms and finals and how he would grade them. He also brought in snacks for the class frequently. However, it wasn't uncommon for his lectures to be unclear at times and a little disorganized/aimless, so read the textbook if you want to make sure of everything.

Shivaji is the reason I found my passion for Political Science. The classes are a bit all over the place, but he teaches in a dialectical manner and teaches through conversation. I would emphasize reading all the slides and making notes as that what the Midterm was on, but otherwise, I would 100% recommend for South Asian Special Topic courses.

Overall chill professor, lectures can be dry as he rambles sometimes but he tries to keep the class engaged through jokes and questions. Nice guy sometimes buys cookies for the class. He makes the content that will be on exams and assignments pretty clear so it's not hard to get a decent grade if you attend lectures and take notes

He is a very kind person! Genuinely kind gave us cookies, even during the midterm. However, I do not think he is fit to be a professor. He does not give rubrics and he's contradicting his assignment file would say something and the syllabus would say something else and he would not clear it up so it gets confusing.
